newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Bulgaria delays choosing telecom sale advisor.
newsitem.headline: Bulgaria delays choosing telecom sale advisor.

text.p: Bulgaria said on Tuesday it will delay issuing a shortlist of financial houses who bid to advise the cabinet in the sale of 25 percent of the state telecoms company as it is seeking more information on the bidders.

"We need to collect additional information for all of the 18 contenders as they all have obvious qualities and experience and are solid investment institutions," Deputy Prime Minister Doncho Konakchiev told a news conference.
He said the cabinet could not take a decision on the basis of the available data and needed more time to gather detailed information and to analyse it.
Konakchiev said he had written to the contenders on Friday asking them to provide additional information to the cabinet within a week.

"The procedure has been delayed as the cabinet wants to take its decision on the grounds of maximum information clarity as the partial privatisation of BTC is a very important and strategically sensitive deal," Konakchiev added.
The cabinet is expected to shortlist the top six banks among the 18 bidders. The World Bank, which is funding part of the BTC sale procedure, must then approve them.
The list includes Investment Bank Austria, Union Bank of Switzerland, and Vienna's Creditanstalt Investment Bank AG together with Sofia's Creditanstalt Bulinvest EOOD.
A consortium of Bankers Trust, Charterhouse Bank, KPMG and Squire Sanders & Dempsey is also bidding. Another consortium is Raiffeisen Investment AG and Lazard Houses.

Other bidders are Deloitte & Touche, Salomon Brothers, Swiss Bank Corp, Merill Lynch International, Warburg, Nat West Markets, Schroders, Deutsche Morgan Grenfell, BZW, Daiwa Europe Ltd, Societe Generale Finance Developpement, Goldman Sachs International and Freshfields.
Officials have said the tender for the BTC partial sale would be called at the end of May or at the beginning of June.
